DataElement.preferredName: Peripheral Neuropathy Moderate Adverse Event Present Code Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The coded response indicating whether a patient meets the eligibility criteria for participation in a clinical trial regarding moderate peripheral neuropathy.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Peripheral Neuropathy Moderate Adverse Event Present
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the presence of a disorder affecting the peripheral nervous system and manifests with pain, tingling, numbness, and muscle weakness experienced as a transient event, requiring no special treatment or intervention._An experience that is alleviated with simple therapeutic treatments. The event impacts usual daily activities. Includes laboratory test alterations indicating injury, but without long-term risk.  See NCI Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: On or near an edge or constituting an outer boundary; the outer area.:A disorder affecting the cranial nerves or the peripheral nervous system.  It is manifested with pain, tingling, numbness, and muscle weakness.  It may be the result of physical injury, toxic substances, viral diseases, diabetes, renal failure, cancer, and drugs. -- 2004

Concepts.definition: On or near an edge or constituting an outer boundary; the outer area.

A disorder affecting the cranial nerves or the peripheral nervous system. It manifests with pain, tingling, numbness, and muscle weakness. It may be the result of physical injury, toxic substances, viral diseases, diabetes, renal failure, cancer, and drugs.

Property.preferredDefinition: An experience that is alleviated with simple therapeutic treatments. The event impacts usual daily activities. Includes laboratory test alterations indicating injury, but without long-term risk.  See NCI Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events.:Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time.

Concepts.definition: An experience that is alleviated with simple therapeutic treatments. The event impacts usual daily activities. Includes laboratory test alterations indicating injury, but without long-term risk.
Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition:
any unfavorable symptoms, signs, or disease temporally associated with the use of a medical
treatment or procedure that may or may not be considered related to the medical
treatment or procedure.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Indicator to represent a response of Yes, No, or Not Applicable._The affirmative response to a question or activity._The non-affirmative response to a question._Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context._A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.:The non-affirmative response to a question.:Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.:An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.
The non-affirmative response to a question.
Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created to support Theradex design of CRFs for NCI CCR trials

ReferenceDocuments.name: Does patient have greater tha
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have greater than or equal to grade 2 peripheral neuropathy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a baseline peripheral neuropathy of Grade 2 or higher?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have symptomatic peripheral neuropathy greater than grade 2 by CTCAE criteria?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have greater than or equal to grade 2 neuropathy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have greater than or equal to grade 3 peripheral neuropathy or grade 2 with pain on clinical examination during the screening period?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have peripheral neuropathy that is greater than or equal to grade 3, or grade 2 with pain on clinical examination during the screening period?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have NCI CTCAE v5 greater than or equal to G2 peripheral neuropathy (sensory or motor)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 6
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have peripheral neuropathy greater than grade 1?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 7
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a pre-existing neuropathy of grade 2 or higher?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 8
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has peripheral neuropathy is it grade less than or equal to 1?
